physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At the age of 9 years, short stature at -2.7 DS, weight and head circumference within normal ranges (-1.9 DS and +1 DS respectively). Dysmorphic features included a large protruding forehead, hypoplastic alae nasi, prominent columella, micrognathia, hypoplastic mandible, and down slanting ears. Hypodontia with small teeth and enamel dysplasia. Upper limb anomalies: absent third digital ray at the right hand with scars of repaired cutaneous syndactyly between the first and second digits, and the fourth and fifth digits. The left hand lacked the second and third digital rays with cutaneous syndactyly between the fourth and fifth fingers. Feet malformations: bilateral central cleft with absent second and third digital rays and syndactyly between the fourth and fifth toes in the left foot. Dermatologic examination revealed dry and hypopigmented skin without palmoplantar keratoderma. Blond thin and sparse hair, hypotrichosis of eyebrows, eyelashes, and temporoparietal scalp. Trichoscopy showed inter and perifollicular scales, sparse hair, miniaturization, and pili torti. Brittle nails and nail pits on the left thumb; reported reduced sweating and hypoplastic nipples.
